data.description:
Ninja style watch. The day of the week is indicated in kanji.

You can change the background color and the date format in the settings page. 

The second hand and the battery level appear for a while by shaking wrist.
data.title: Ninja Clock

data.author: James Brown

changelog.release_notes: Add support for Aplite (Pebble O.G. and Pebble Steel), as long as they've upgraded to the 3.x firmware

Configuration is finally upon us!

 - Select between Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin for temperature display!
 - Four expertly-designed themes!
 - Change the time update interval to per-second if you really want to

- Fix accidental inversion of day and night symbols
 - Fix race condition that could cause weather to be updated every 60m instead of every 30m
Add a splash of color; fix some bugs.

Oops! The font changes in v1.2 accidentally cut off the least-significant digit of the epoch timestamp. This release fixes that.

It also adds the display of the (lat,lng) for which weather has been retrieved.
Better, bigger fonts! Fixed a memory leak! Whee!
Add weather support! I haven't built a config screen yet, so you're stuck with Â°F, my dinky free OWM key, and 30 minute updates.

data.description:
Really simple Pebble watchface which displays the current time, the current date, and the current Unix Timestamp ("epoch time"). Unlike every other epoch time watchface I could find, it only updates once a minute by default, so is polite to your battery. Displays the local weather.

Now configurable!

latest_release.release_notes: Add support for Aplite (Pebble O.G. and Pebble Steel), as long as they've upgraded to the 3.x firmware

data.description:
KiezelFit

This is a paid watch-face. You can purchase this face individually for $0.99 or purchase our entire collection of 20+ faces for $5.99. You can purchase within the settings page.

If you love our faces, give us a heart. Thank you!

Kiezel Fit is aimed to help you live a healthier life. Set a goal for how many steps youâd like to walk in a day and track your progress throughout the day. Outside bar tracks how close you are to reaching your goal. Actual step count in the top complication and the current date is in the bottom complication.

And as always color presets and the ability to customize all the colors to your liking.

Enjoy!

Team Kiezel-
data.title: Kiezel Fit

data.author: Yuriy Galanter

changelog.release_notes: - fixed misaligned digital time on PTR
- added Pebble2/Diorite and Timeline quick glance support
- fixed themes being lost on watchface reload

- fixed crashes on OG Pebbles
- updated gradients on PT/PTR
- restored manual location, now by coords

- More color themes
- fixed mis-drawing of half-circles on PTR when battery at 100%
- new color themes and other visual updates
- switched fitness goals (inner line) to display only step goals

data.description:
$0.99 USD via Kiezel Pay

This is the face of the future.

Two faces actually - because you get both analog and digital face - and it's up to you which one to use. You also get eight predefined color themes as well as ability to set each color individually. This face also provides weather and fitness tracking at your fingertips. And it just looks cool.

Key features:

- Digital or Analog face type selection
- Multiple color themes as well as custom color settings (or you can leave it on auto and the color will depend on battery level)
- Weather (powered by Forecast.io), Step Counter, Distance Walked, Sleep Hours
- Bluetooth Connect/Disconnect alert of configurable intensity with visual clue
- Battery level represented by percentage number as well as visually by outer perimeter of dots (also by watchface color - if in auto color mode).
- Visual step goals

After installing watchface you have a 3-day trial period to explore all the features and different aspects. At the end of trial if you like Future Time and want to keep it - it's just $0.99 USD via Kiezel Pay payment system, you will be prompted to enter code and follow few easy payment steps. Once purchased - the watchface is yours permanently, no matter what Pebble or what phone you use, as long as you keep the same Pebble account.

You will need to get free key for weather services at https://developer.forecast.io - this is one time procedure.

Design by Paul Joel http://www.pauljoel.com

latest_release.release_notes: - fixed misaligned digital time on PTR

data.title: Future Time

data.author: HBTeicher
data.description:
Tribute watchface to the Omega Speedmaster Professional, the first watch worn by an astronaut walking on the moon during the Apollo 11 mission, July 1969.

- Flick of the wrist shows current (Earth) time.
- Long battery life
data.title: Omega Moon Tribute

data.author: HBTeicher
data.description:
As a watch, the Pebble Smartwatch is unique for many reasons - including its ability to present time in a completely new way. As a non-numeric person, I find it incredibly intuitive to read time as natural language - give it a try today!  
- Natural language time in English.  
- Accelerometer flick alternates current date, week number and precise current time in 24H format. 
- Battery indicator bar. 
- Vibrates on loss of BlueTooth connection.
data.title: Natural Language Round Light

data.author: HBTeicher
data.description:

data.description:
Another watchface for the Trek fans.

This is a bit simpler, though has a variety of images to display.

View the time in large numbers, or set it to random (with one of the smaller date/time formats), to move through 13 images (currently) - they swap every minute - if when selecting the option it doesn't switch immediately, wait for the next minute change. 

An image can also be selected permanently - to view time,  select one of the date formats that include time.

If you have a fave, and its not there, just email me and i'll put it in the mix. 

The outer ring changes colour according to the battery charge level. 
Battery number is shown in small text at the six position. 

Bluetooth state is at the 12 position - it'll turn grey if BT is lost. 

Flick to display a seconds ring (it'll remain there for 40 seconds). Minutes are also shown by the black gap in the dark grey ring.

new settings page style

data.description:
Watch face for easy walkers!

You can show current step count with stacked bar chart.

* features of steps
 - display current steps
 - display stacked bar chart of steps of while morning(0:00-10:00), daytime(10:00-17:00), night(17:00-24:00)
 - you can set two target , normal level and high level 
 - you can select average steps instead of normal level target
 - you can know if achieve target with STAR
 - you can enable vibe at achieve target

* general features
 - you can select color theme
 - you can select time time 12H or 24H
 - you can select date format Mon/day or Day/Mon
 - display bluetooth connection status
 - you can enable vibe on disconnect
 - display battery level status
 - you can enable vibe hourly
 - you can select ahead of time for vibe hourly
 - you can select start and end hour of vibe hourly
 - pop up message window on vibe at hourly, disconnect, achieve target

A watch that shows the day kilometers/miles and calories done. The kilometers-miles and celsius - farenheit options are selected from mobile setup.
Displays some arches showing the percentage has been met daily and weekly target. The purple arc is the weekly percentage. The other can change color depending on the activity that is being done.

Icon shows the time and the actual temperature.
And of course, the time and date.

data.description:
Updated to use Pebble's Unobstructed Area API to show timeline Quick Views!

Theta is a clean and glancable watch face designed to make the most of your screen's real estate. The angle of the inner ring shows hours, while the angle of the outer ring shows minutes. The inner display has two complications, which can each be configured to display one of the following:

1. The time in digital format
2. The month
3. The day of the month
4. The day of the week
5. The date in US format (jan/01)
6. The date the way the rest of the world writes it (01/jan)
7. Weekday, date (ex. fri, 16)
8. Steps
9. Distance walked (km)
10. Distance walked (miles)
11. Calories burned

Colors can be set manually or to change randomly. Random colors change every hour, on the hour or whenever the watch face is closed and reopened. 
*Because pulling random colors from Pebble's whole palette tends to create combinations with poor contrast, several smaller palettes have have been hand picked and added to the options. The dark and light settings have exceptionally good contrast.

Additionally, the center line can configured to indicate battery level. Theta can also be configured to vibrate and show a symbol when bluetooth has been disconnected.

The screenshots above show the following times:
1. 7:55
2. 10:30
3. 6:15
4. 6:50

As always, please feel free to email me with the 'Contact Developer' button for any issues, requests, recommendations, or for any other reason.
data.title: Theta

+ Easy to read analog time
+ Day of month and day of week
+ Current temperature and weather condition (celcius or fahrenheit)
+ Activities during last 12 hours in outer ring, instensity shown
+ Battery bar with color emphasizing current level
+ Bluetooth connection alert (vibration & icon)
+ Colors fully customizable

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.description:
Time displayed in 4 segments of expanding rectangles overlapping each other.  
Top left are 10-hours, top right single hours, bottom left 10-minutes and bottom right single minutes.  Hours are blue, minutes yellow/orange.

Can display in 12 or 24 hour mode depending on watch settings.  If in 12-hour mode, 2 red center rectangles display AM (left) and PM (right).

Screenshots:  12:59AM, 18:45 (24-hour mode), 7:35AM, 23:46 (24-hour), 4:23PM (with Quick View)


Design & Programming Copyright Â© 2016 Nev Rawlins

data.author: AMathMonkey

changelog.release_notes: I'm not a coder, so this is a simple first version with no configurability.

data.description: This is Samalander's code, so all credit goes to him! I just upgraded from the Classic to the Time, and I began to miss the most useful watch face ever, Big H. It had seconds, battery, the full date, and a display of the days of the week, 3 days into the future and 3 days in the past. I couldn't live without it. So, I altered some of the assets and some of the code for Big H in order to spice it up a bit for the Pebble Time. Configuration is broken for the time being, but I think it's configured to be at its most useful. Enjoy!

latest_release.release_notes: I'm not a coder, so this is a simple first version with no configurability.

data.description:
A simple and elegant analog watchface for Pebble Time.

It just shows the current minute, hour and date. It is much better readable than the Pebble Time's default watchface Tictoc due to its tiny ticks at the edge.

data.author: Gektron Ltd
data.description:
Star Wars themed watch face. Every minute the Tie Fighter flies in a circle displaying the new time on its wing, with the rotating Death Star in the background. The 3D animation is a lot smoother than shown in this choppy animated GIF.

The time uses 12 or 24 hour format depending on your watch settings, and it turns red when the battery level drops to 20% or below.

It's a monochromatic watch face, but Tie Fighters and Death Stars are not exactly colorful!

Another watch face from Gektron Ltd using the P3D graphics engine.
data.title: Tie Fighter

data.description:
Google image search on your watch! Enter a search term and get a random image from Google's image search (top 50 results) on your watch. Now without hangs and Bluetooth disconnect noise and auto-retry (and proper UUID...).
Some search terms to try:
beautiful
beauty
simpsons
minions
landscapes
totoro
darth vader
terminator
spock


Enjoy a refreshing view! Updates on shake or on a pre-set interval in settings. The original image is converted via pebconv.respawned.com. If the watchface becomes successful I will add more gimmicks. Google's new API limits search queries per day, but I try to keep it going. Have fun!

latest_release.release_notes:
- added dithering option
- added circles in outer ring to distinguish hour quicker

changelog.release_notes:
Version 2.3:
- Circular Plus returns to Pebble OG and Pebble Steel models! Currently featuring animation on shake with more features to come.

Version 2.2:
- Cleaned up for FW 3.10
- Removed necessity to restart after toggling animation

Version 2.1:
- Added colour customisation!
  + Customisable via the configuration page
  + Change colours individually or choose from pre-made colour schemes
  + Submit colour scheme suggestions and you might get featured!

Don't forget to heart this face and email me if you have a question.

data.description:
Circular Plus v2 is a follow up of my watchface Circular+. It has been completely rewritten with SDK 3.x and has been optimised for the latest firmware. Unfortunately, not all features have yet been ported from the old version.

Features:
- Smooth animation on launch
- Animation on shake (can be turned off in options)
- Battery indication with colours
- Semi-analogue display

data.description:
This design Watchface has an amazing style and font.
Features :
- Multilingual
- Date (Days, months) and time + seconds
- Display of the distance in meters (will be possible to change it in a future version)
- Display of the bluetooth connection
- Display of the battery level
- Display of the localisation (with GPS or default localisation)
- Display of the present temperature (Â°C or Â°F) and the local weather forecast
- For the Pebble time and Pebble classic, display of the forecast temperature with dynamic graduations.

Options can be configurable :
- Active or deactivate  weather
- Activate or deactivate  geolocalisation
- Save a default localisation
- Change  temperature unit (Â°C or Â°F)
- Select the weather refresh
- Activate or deactivate bluetooth deconnection vibe
- Activate or deactivate bluetooth connection vibe
- Activate or deactivate bluetooth deconnection light
- Activate or deactivate bluetooth connection light
- Activate or deactivate Health feature
- Change the Health unit (Meters or Steps)
- Active or deactivate second
- Change the Watchface theme

To view the weather, you must own a API Key on the Open Weather Map website (it's free)

Compatible Pebble classic, Pebble Time and Pebble Round.

Should you find mistakes dont hesitate to contact me.

If you like this Watchface, please add your Â« heart Â» to the top :).

latest_release.release_notes:
- Many optimisations / corrections

New features :
- Change the range of the temperature graph

data.title: Updated Watch

data.author: Luke Arms

changelog.release_notes:
As promised: themes! For now, there are two to choose from: light and dark. We think the light one is going to look particularly nice on Pebble Time Round (not that we have one ourselves).

PS: there's a PayPal "Donate" button on the settings page if you feel like throwing us a US dollar or two.

We received a bunch of requests for a way to disable the seconds hand, especially from Pebble Time Round users. So we've added a setting for that. It's called "Battery saving mode". It works :)

We've also made other improvements to performance and battery life, and have added the ability to manage your own step target rather than using your average steps from the last 7 days (this is optional).

Coming soon: selectable themes.

Thanks for using minim!

We've added support for Pebble Health! The following features are automatically enabled if you're using Pebble's "Health" app and have at least 1 day of activity data available:

(1) The outer ring is now a progress bar for today's steps. Complete the circle by reaching your average daily step count (calculated over the last 7 days). The centre pin turns green when you complete the circle. A future version will allow you to set your target step count if desired.

(2) When Pebble determines you're having a "restful sleep", the seconds hand is disabled to save battery, and the other hands are only moved every 60 seconds.

We've made some other improvements that should improve battery life too. Enjoy :)

data.description:
(New in 1.3: theme selection. Light and dark themes available.)

Inspired by classic analog watches, minim embraces the power of Pebble without turning your wrist into a miniature control panel.

With Pebble Health enabled, the outer ring doubles as a progress bar for today's steps. Choose your target step count or let minim figure it out from your recent health data. When you complete the circle by reaching your target, the centre pin turns green.

The centre pin also provides battery level feedback. It turns red when Pebble's battery reaches 20% or below. (When charging, it flashes red. When fully charged, it flashes green.)

Speaking of batteries, you might want to enable "Battery saving mode". You'll lose the seconds hand but gain hours of battery life. Decisions, decisions!

(If you like seconds hands, all is not lost: battery saving mode turns on automatically when you're having a "deep sleep".)

And finally, because smart watches should be smart, today's date is never hidden. It moves clockwise as needed to stay clear of the hours and minutes hands.

latest_release.release_notes:
As promised: themes! For now, there are two to choose from: light and dark. We think the light one is going to look particularly nice on Pebble Time Round (not that we have one ourselves).

PS: there's a PayPal "Donate" button on the settings page if you feel like throwing us a US dollar or two.

data.title: minim

data.author: Jan-Michael Cruz

changelog.release_notes: Fixed the bug where zeros were being incorrectly stripped from the date.
I changed the update period to be once per minute from once per second. It means that you'll have to wait longer for your step count updates, but at least the watch won't run out of battery.

data.title: Indication

data.author: Max Beckett

changelog.release_notes:
Version 1.1:
- Added a short METAR option, with station name, time, wind, and QNH/altimeter.

data.description:
METAR-Analogue is a watchface for pilots that shows the time in the form of a smart analogue clock and the weather in the form of a metar. The display is optimised for European metars, however other locales will work (although longer ones with RMKs e.g. USA might be cut off).

Features:
- Location-aware METAR finding
- Customisation of GPS and station
- Colour coded conditions (green = VFR, blue = MVFR, purple = LIFR, red = IFR)
- Regular 20 minute updates in line with release of metar.
- Animation on launch
- Day of month shown in colour of condition

latest_release.release_notes:
Version 1.1:
- Added a short METAR option, with station name, time, wind, and QNH/altimeter.

data.title: METAR Analogue

data.author: BV Designs

changelog.release_notes: Version 2.62: Now available for Pebble 2 and Pebble Time 2!
Version 2.61: Addition of BPM and unobstructed improvements.
Version 2.50:  Now with the option to choose static instead of automatic background colour.
Version 2.01:  Fixed the battery bar issue of not updating to correctly reflect the battery level.

Version 2.0: NEW features added! 
- Now including a settings configuration page 
- Option to change date formats (UK & US style) 
- Option to vibrate when disconnected
- Date displays the language chosen in user settings 
- NEW battery bar for Pebble Time and Round users! Sitting unobtrusively below the time, the bar indicates the battery level as follows:-
    - GREEN when 80% and over
    - ORANGE when between 30% - 80%
    - RED when under 30%

Simple watchface with a daily step counter at the bottom. The time appears in 12 or 24 hour mode depending on your Pebble settings. The background colour randomly changes each minute. The white stripe in the middle disappears when Bluetooth is disconnected. Vibrates with each connection status. Enjoy, and send a heart if you do!! Please check out my other watchfaces as well.

data.description:
*** Also check out and install my new watchfaces, BEACON and Retro Digital! You'll love them as much as this one! ***

Now available for Pebble 2 and Pebble Time 2 with BPM!! 

Version 2.50: Added an option to choose a static instead of automatic background colour. 

Version 2.0: NEW features added! 
- Now including a settings configuration page 
- Option to change date formats (UK & US style) 
- Option to vibrate when disconnected
- Date displays the language chosen in user settings 
- NEW battery bar for Pebble Time and Round users! Sitting unobtrusively below the time, the bar indicates the battery level as follows:-
    - GREEN when 80% and over
    - ORANGE when between 30% - 80%
    - RED when under 30%

Simple watchface with a daily step counter at the bottom.  The time appears in 12 or 24 hour mode depending on your Pebble settings.  The background colour randomly changes each minute.  The white stripe in the middle disappears when Bluetooth is disconnected. Vibrates with each connection status. 

Enjoy, and send a heart if you do!!

data.author: Gektron Ltd

changelog.release_notes:
Bug fix for 12 hour clock display. 00:xx is now shown correctly as 12:xx
Thanks Kevin

data.description:
This watch face is the first tech demo of my new Pebble 3D graphics engine. This demo includes solid, dithered and wireframe rending. Additionally the time digits and battery indicator perform an animation on every minute change.

The time is displayed in 12 hour or 24 hour format depending on your watch settings, and the digits are rendered with rainbow colors based on the time of day.

The battery indicator is usually green, but transitions to red at 20%.

My next project using the 3D engine is another watch face based on Star Wars, then I will write a 3D game for the Pebble. Look out for these in the near future, or email me with suggestions or to be notified of the next watch face or game.

latest_release.release_notes:
Bug fix for 12 hour clock display. 00:xx is now shown correctly as 12:xx
